Posted By: Duskdale_Wurm (6/7/2010 7:29:49 PM)
Rating:

@Blackworm_Bloodworm: I'll downvote any person who states "... just about each block we get creatures that overshadow ", and then goes on to compare it to Rakdos Cackler (from the newest set) while wrongly using the term "strictly better".
First off, there haven't been a single hybrid red/green 1-drop as good as Tattermunge Maniac since Tattermunge Maniac. Comparing it to Goblin Guide and the like just won't do, because this card has the advantage of being hybrid in a multicolor deck. This is especially relevant if you're running "color matters" cards (Boartusk Liege etc.).
Secondly, Rakdos Cackler doesn't have the same colors as Tattermunge Maniac, and therefore isn't "strictly better" - you can't play it with green mana. You want strictly better? Take Walking Corpse and compare it with Spineless Thug or Scathe Zombies.... (see all)
Report Abuse  
Posted By: GrimjawxRULES (10/2/2012 3:59:16 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Dies to [Boros Recruit](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Boros Recruit). :)  
  
(edit) Perhaps I should elaborate:  
This card is really underwhelming. It's not that good. And just about each block we get creatures that overshadow it. Take [Rakdos Cackler](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rakdos Cackler), which is strictly better as it can be a 1/1 capable of chump blocking, or a 2/2 that you don't have to attack with.   
Tattermunge Maniac wouldn't be blocking either way, but at least Cackler doesn't have to suicide.   
  
Consider creatures like [Vexing Devil](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vexing Devil) who does a **lot** for just ![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol) or [Goblin Guide](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Guide), a 2/2 hasty for ![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol) whose drawback isn't really a drawback. Both creatures do even more for the same cost. Even ![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol), a more control-oriented color, has [Diregraf Ghoul](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Diregraf Ghoul) and [Gravecrawler](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gravecrawler).  
  
Consider [Kird Ape](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kird Ape), who should always be a 2/3 whenever you drop him, or [Isamaru, Hound of Konda](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Isamaru, Hound of Konda) who is always a 2/2 or [Savannah L](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Savannah L)... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

(edit) Perhaps I should elaborate:
This card is really underwhelming. It's not that good. And just about each block we get creatures that overshadow it. Take Rakdos Cackler, which is strictly better as it can be a 1/1 capable of chump blocking, or a 2/2 that you don't have to attack with.
Tattermunge Maniac wouldn't be blocking either way, but at least Cackler doesn't have to suicide.

Consider creatures like Vexing Devil who does a lot for just or Goblin Guide, a 2/2 hasty for whose drawback isn't really a drawback. Both creatures do even more for the same cost. Even , a more control-oriented color, has Diregraf Ghoul and Gravecrawler.
